content.description: Climb out of an alcove via a continuous crack with varied jams.
content.protection: This route has lots of opportunity for protection.  A standard rack should do it, with emphasis on hand and fist sized cams or big stoppers.
content.location: Starts in the alcove left of The Demon's first two bolts and goes up the rightmost crack.  Shares an anchor with The Demon.

content.description: A great climb on scary home-made bolt hangers.  Tons of variety: chimney moves, arete, slab climbing.  The crux is when you exit the chimney and pull over the bulge of the arete at the second bolt.
content.protection: There are six bolts with some home-made hangers that look a bit questionable.  I backed up the crux on the arete pull with an extra nut, and you could also place a hand sized cam at the top before the chains.  Probably best to just walk around and top-rope it though.
content.location: This is the rightmost line in the area, and the only fully bolted sport route.

content.description: Really fun face climbing with limited protection.  It's probably best done as a top rope.
content.protection: Two bolts at the start of the climb with limited nut placements above it.  Probably best done on top rope.
content.location: The first two bolts highlight the start of the route just to the right of the chimney/alcove start to Miller High Life.  This climb shares anchors with Miller High Life.
